A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This film failed to resonate with me as a movie in its own right and stands as an abomination for a Star Wars main film instalment. It is so self absorbed in trying to be socially relevant and going out of its way to contradict fan theories that the fun factor is entirely non existant. It's greatest crime is in how it treats arguably one of the greatest heroes in pop culture history\, Luke Skywalker\, emasculating and disfiguring him to the point where he is a barely recognisable defeated and miserable man. This wasn't taking him into a new direction\, this was simply a flat out mistake. I have never ever felt this frustrated about any film\, least of all a Star Wars film. I have never ever considered taking time to sign up on a review website to comment on anything until now\, so this is my first time rating anything. This film wasn't just a disappointment\, it is a tragedy.
